exercise: Create a string variable with your name and use a for loop to print each character on a separate line.
Create a tuple of your favorite colors and use a for loop to print each color.
Create a list of mixed data types (integers, strings, floats) and use a for loop to print the type of each element using the type() function.
Create a tuple containing a list of numbers. Use a for loop to iterate through the tuple and then another nested for loop to iterate through the list.
Create a list of strings and use a for loop to create a new list containing the length of each string.
Create a list of strings and use a for loop to create a new list containing the uppercase version of each string.
Write a for loop that iterates through a tuple of strings and creates a dictionary where the keys are the strings and the values are their lengths.
Create a list of strings and use a for loop to count how many uppercase letters are in each string. Store the counts in a new list.
Write a for loop that iterates through a string and creates a dictionary where the keys are the unique characters and the values are the number of times each character appears.
Create a list of strings and use a for loop to create a new list containing only the palindromes (words that read the same forwards and backwards). Use string methods to check for palindromes.
